fields.description: Indicates the configured authentication type for the domain. The value is either Managed or Federated. Managed indicates a cloud managed domain where Microsoft Entra ID performs user authentication. Federated indicates authentication is federated with an identity provider such as the tenant's on-premises Active Directory via Active Directory Federation Services. Not nullable.  To update this property in delegated scenarios, the calling app must be assigned the Directory.AccessAsUser.All delegated permission.
fields.name: AuthenticationType

fields.description: This property is always null except when the verify action is used. When the verify action is used, a domain entity is returned in the response. The availabilityStatus property of the domain entity in the response is either AvailableImmediately or EmailVerifiedDomainTakeoverScheduled.
fields.name: AvailabilityStatus

fields.description: The objects such as users and groups that reference the domain ID. Read-only, Nullable. Supports $expand and $filter by the OData type of objects returned. For example, /domains/{domainId}/domainNameReferences/microsoft.graph.user and /domains/{domainId}/domainNameReferences/microsoft.graph.group.
fields.name: DomainNameReferences

fields.description: List of OData IDs for `DomainNameReferences` to bind to this entity
fields.name: DomainNameReferences_ODataBind

fields.description: Domain settings configured by customer when federated with Microsoft Entra ID. Supports $expand.
fields.name: FederationConfiguration

fields.description: The value of the property is false if the DNS record management of the domain is delegated to Microsoft 365. Otherwise, the value is true. Not nullable.
fields.name: IsAdminManaged

fields.description: true for the default domain that is used for user creation. There's only one default domain per company. Not nullable.
fields.name: IsDefault

fields.description: true for the initial domain created by Microsoft Online Services. For example, contoso.onmicrosoft.com. There's only one initial domain per company. Not nullable.
fields.name: IsInitial

fields.description: true if the domain is a verified root domain. Otherwise, false if the domain is a subdomain or unverified. Not nullable.
fields.name: IsRoot

fields.description: true for verified domains. Not nullable.
fields.name: IsVerified

fields.description: Specifies the number of days before a user receives a password expiry notification. 14 days by default.
fields.name: PasswordNotificationWindowInDays

fields.description: Specifies the length of time that a password is valid before it must be changed. 90 days by default.
fields.name: PasswordValidityPeriodInDays

fields.description: Root domain of a subdomain. Read-only, Nullable. Supports $expand.
fields.name: RootDomain

fields.description: DNS records the customer adds to the DNS zone file of the domain before the domain can be used by Microsoft Online services. Read-only, Nullable. Supports $expand.
fields.name: ServiceConfigurationRecords

fields.description: Status of asynchronous operations scheduled for the domain.
fields.name: State

fields.description: The capabilities assigned to the domain. Can include 0, 1, or more of following values: Email, Sharepoint, EmailInternalRelayOnly, OfficeCommunicationsOnline,SharePointDefaultDomain, FullRedelegation, SharePointPublic, OrgIdAuthentication, Yammer, Intune, CustomUrlDomain. The values that you can add or remove using the API include: Email, OfficeCommunicationsOnline, Yammer, and CustomUrlDomain. Not nullable.  For more information about CustomUrlDomain, see Custom URL domains in external tenants.
fields.name: SupportedServices

fields.description: DNS records that the customer adds to the DNS zone file of the domain before the customer can complete domain ownership verification with Microsoft Entra ID. Read-only, Nullable. Supports $expand.
fields.name: VerificationDnsRecords
